alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 28 at 7:08PM MST until May 29 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the Wind Advisory on Sunday, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Coconino County, Navajo County, and Apache County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 9 PM MST this evening. For the second Wind Advisory, from 11 AM to 8 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. In addition, winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Patchy blowing dust is also possible over the lower elevations of northeast Arizona including portions of Highway 89 from Flagstaff to Page, and Highway 191 from Chinle to Rock Point.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
